verb.description: Give (someone or oneself) a different appearance in order to conceal one's identity.
examples: we took elaborate measures to disguised ourselves as locals
Brian was disguised as a priest

noun.description: A means of altering one's appearance or concealing one's identity.
examples: his bizarre disguise drew stares from fellow shoppers

origin: Middle English (meaning change one's usual style of dress, with no implication of concealing one's identity): from Old French desguisier.
